clinical_study.brief_title: Longitudinal Study Evaluating Recovery After Scheduled Cesarean Delivery
clinical_study.official_title: Longitudinal Study Evaluating Postpartum Recovery After Scheduled Cesarean Delivery With the Obstetric Quality of Recovery Tool

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research is to describe how patients recover after scheduled C-section for the first 3 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between postpartum ObsQOR-10 and EQ-5D
primary_outcome.description: EQ-5D describes current health for mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain, anxiety and on a scale of 0-100 to indicate current health status with 0 being the worst imaginable health and 100 being the best health imaginable. The ObsQOR-10 uses a scale of 0-10 with 0 being none and 10 being the worst imaginable, scoring pain, nausea, dizziness, shivering, comfort level, mobilization, holding baby, feeding baby, personal care, and feeling in control. r cesarean delivery and at 6 weeks post partum.

secondary_outcome.description: Describes pain from no pain at all to the worst pain imaginable using a 100mm horizontal line

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare non-maternal reasons for delayed hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Document non-maternal reasons for delayed hospital discharge such as NICU admission of neonate, neonatal IV antibiotics, delay in transportation, delay from pediatric team.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare frequency of activities of daily living
secondary_outcome.description: Activities of daily living are routine activities people do everyday without assistance including eating, bathing, getting dressed, toileting, cooking, cleaning, driving, shopping. Subject will report these activities as not done yet, done once, once/week, do most days, do every day

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare a modified recovery after delivery questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: 9 questions that ask the mother about feeding baby, sleep, fatigue, bonding, parenting, and social functioning

arm_group.description: All participants will complete questionnaires at several time points, ranging from baseline to 3 months post partum.

intervention.description: All participants will complete surveys that range in time from baseline to 3 months post partum.

study_pop.textblock: Parturients scheduled for cesarean delivery at Mayo Clinic Hospital Family Birth Center

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women 18 years of age or older who receive neuraxial anesthesia for elective cesarean delivery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Less than 18 years of age
- Gestational age less than 32 weeks
- Women whose infants have died or are in the neonatal intensive care unit after delivery
- Inability to read or understand written English
- Failed neuraxial anesthesia requiring general anesthesia

eligibility.gender_description: Women whom are pregnant and will have a scheduled C-section to deliver infant
